stream_context.summary: Kaze prototyped an arts-and-crafts "cardboard" sub-area (likely Course 14) focused on falling, colour-coded platforms and proximity-activated saws over a lava void while troubleshooting scaling, textures, and emulator quirks.

development_findings.summary: The new sub-area centres on small, coloured cardboard platforms that drop when Mario approaches, with saw blades that start moving when the player is near, creating a fast, race-like challenge.
development_findings.quote: "So you do have to constantly move pretty fast to not die in this level, and eventually there will be a star somewhere."

development_findings.summary: Platform sizes are varied by editing the actor’s B Berms value; Kaze scaled platforms on a single axis and used rounding to ensure exact fits between segments.
development_findings.quote: "If I set this one to F, then it will scale up by 10 … I did that to allow for more variety here."

development_findings.summary: Initial idea to make Mario’s cap texture display at half size on emulator (to look crisper) was tested and rejected to avoid visual inconsistency and option creep.
development_findings.quote: "I think it looks like shit by the way, so I'm not adding this."

development_findings.summary: Floor treatment is unresolved; Kaze wants the space to feel like a painted set or an arbitrary black void but worries about repetitive tiling and is considering dynamic vertex/UV generation.
development_findings.quote: "I do like the idea that it's all just painted, but painted is probably going to also look kind of bad because of all the repetitions."

development_findings.summary: Invisible walls and conveyor actors are being weighed; conveyors use level geometry graphics with actor logic that detects Mario’s radius and pushes him.
development_findings.quote: "There's an actor that's like, if you're in this radius and you're in this collision type, then just push Mario back."

development_findings.summary: Kaze predicted finished-game speedruns: any % about 80–85 minutes and 100 % roughly 3–3.5 hours, assuming no major skips.
development_findings.quote: "Realistically, once this game is done, any % ... probably around 80-85 minutes."

development_findings.summary: Course 1 public demo is still planned; a well-hidden N64 rendition of Delfino Plaza will be unlockable inside that demo.
development_findings.quote: "I'm probably also gonna just randomly throw in Delfino Plaza on the N64 into the demo … I'm gonna hide that really well."

development_findings.summary: He considered an open-world Mario 64 hack (à la Bowser’s Fury/TotK) but doubts having time to pursue it.
development_findings.quote: "I would like to do an open-world Mario 64 at some point but whether I'll have time … probably not."

development_findings.summary: Parallel Launcher and some graphic plug-ins cannot render coins correctly; Kaze still relies on Mupen/Glide for development and warns viewers about emulator bugs.
development_findings.quote: "What a garbage-ass … everyone’s telling me to use this and it's just… I hate it."

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s core passion is building the game; YouTube content is pursued mainly for income rather than creative fulfilment.
context_findings.quote: "There’s two things I care about … making my video game and making money. Making YouTube videos … just a way to make money."

context_findings.summary: He works early while Zeina takes longer to wake; breakfast happens once she’s up, indicating home-work integration.
context_findings.quote: "I usually work before breakfast ... Zeina takes so long out of bed that after we get up, I go down and I start working and then we eat."

context_findings.summary: Shows frustration with toolchain (Fast64 errors, emulator bugs) but copes with humour and community banter.
Holds a minimalist philosophy toward options—prefers fewer user toggles to keep the experience focused.
context_findings.quote: "I'm not adding options for every little baby thing. Less options is better, don't you ask me."

biobak.summary: Chat referenced being a "Biobak fan", but no concrete development contribution from Biobak was discussed in this stream.

zeina.summary: Zeina’s slower morning routine indirectly shapes Kaze’s early-work schedule; no direct project tasks mentioned.

key_stories.title: Scrapped Cap-Texture Experiment
key_stories.summary: Kaze tested drawing Mario’s cap at half resolution only on emulator to counteract perceived blurriness. After live evaluation he judged it ugly and unnecessary.
key_stories.challenge: Community feedback that the hat looked "too crusty" on emulator.
key_stories.process: Wrote conditional code to swap textures and previewed both versions live.
key_stories.outcome: Decided against shipping the change and reinforced stance on avoiding micro-options.
key_stories.key_quote: I think it looks like shit, so I'm not adding this.

key_stories.title: Emulator Frustration
key_stories.summary: Parallel Launcher repeatedly failed to render coins and accept controller input on-stream, forcing Kaze back to Mupen64. He vented about community pressure to adopt new tools.
key_stories.challenge: Inconsistent graphics and input when running the hack through Parallel Launcher.
key_stories.process: Demonstrated failures live, switched plug-ins, compared outputs.
key_stories.outcome: Continued development on Mupen/Glide and publicly cautioned viewers about emulator bugs.
key_stories.key_quote: I just showed you that it has bugs live on stream. This is not a matter of agreeing or disagreeing.

key_stories.title: Building the Cardboard Race
key_stories.summary: Kaze devised a sub-area where falling cardboard platforms and reactive saws create a fast, high-stakes traversal. He iterated on platform scaling, spacing, and colour while testing difficulty.
key_stories.challenge: Designing engaging yet fair platforming with limited asset types.
key_stories.process: Used B Berms scaling, adjusted UVs, resized gaps, and manually play-tested until flow felt right.
key_stories.outcome: Final layout approved on-stream; next steps are adding saw logic and refining floor visuals.
key_stories.key_quote: I'm going to platform through this once to make sure I like the platforming … I am liking this.
